items.title: CBS' next top editor to be Bari Weiss of The Free Press
items.description: CBS' parent company will buy The Free Press and install Bari Weiss, its contrarian founder, as editor in chief of CBS News.

items.title: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu Resigns

items.title: Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine Is Awarded for Work on Immune Systems
items.description: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Shimon Sakaguchi were awarded the prize for research showing how the body regulates its immune responses.

items.title: Amid funding cuts and public health battles, NIH issues autism research grants
items.description: Cornell University will receive $5.1 million as the Trump administration seeks to find a source and cure for autism.

items.description: The explorer’s journey to Antarctica was likely doomed before it began.

items.title: Jilly Cooper, British Romance Novelist, Is Dead at 88
items.description: A prolific writer and keen observer, she sold millions of copies of her juicy, sometimes racy “Rutshire Chronicles” series.
